page.title: 17Berwick village
page.content: The village of Berwick comprises Upper and Lower Berwick, and the more modern part which developed by the railway station is simply called Berwick. Berwick straggles along the B2l08 on which the traffic is regularly halted by the closed level crossing gates. The post office and public house lie on the south side of the crossing, with the village shop, taxi service and garage/petrol station on the other, plus the recreation ground with wooden club house. The houses are mainly detached, individual in style, ranging in date from l850 to l930 and the l980s. North of the railway on the western side of the road is a row of detached houses with unusually long front gardens but with no garages or pavement. Opposite is a row of semi-detached houses many with garages and fronted by a footpath.
